body.p:
Liberty Kentucky
Septr 7th 1865
To His Excellency
Thos E Bramlette
Gov of Kentucky

Your petitioners the undersigned would respectfully represent to your honor Excellency that they ^are^ sureties in a bail bond for $20000 for the appearance of one Henry J. Loman for his appearance at the present term of the Casey Circuit Court We bailed him out of Jail for the purpose of letting him go into the army to release a poor man with a large family who had been drafted and could not buy out and had no one to support his helpless family. We have received no benefit from his release ourselves and suppose Loman is now in the army. Under the Circumstances we hope your Excellency will regard the facts herein stated as a proper subject for Executive Clemency, Many of the sure-
ties are poor and the burden will fall on a few of us --

Very respectfully
John Earle
John Dever
Wm spagens
J.. P.. flanagains
Johnaton Gadbary
R.. peyton
V.. peyton
J. G meanelly
W. G. Johnson
Adam carpenter
We concur in statements and ^he prayer &^ request contained in the foregoing petition

J F Bell
M H Owsley
M, J, Durham
Hiram Thomas
Fon. T. Fox
Frank Wolford
Joel Sweeney

Casey Cir Ct
vs
Sureties on Bail Bond of Henry J Loman for $200,
Remit 15 Sept /65
